The message of the song, I believe, is simple: she still loves Lindsey. She always considered Lindsey to be the love of her life, even after she left him and they both were with other people. Accordingly, the song starts out very sad. No one knows how much she misses him - but even if they did, they wouldn't like it. Perhaps she feels people (maybe even Lindsey) have grown tired of hearing her dwell on it so much, or impatient with her for mourning a love she ended. [...] no matter if he loves her or hates her, she will still love him. [...] she talks of missing having Lindsey as a friend as well, and not just as a lover. They were friends before they were lovers, but when their relationship ended, that ended, too. I doubt she got to see Lindsey smile much in the aftermath, and that made her sad. Then she adds that no one can understand him, but that doesn't matter to her. The implication here is that his complexity is one of the things she loved about him, as directly after that statement, she repeats that she still loves him. Even after so much time has passed, she still can't get over him, even though, again, she was the one who ended it. [...] they'll never get back together. Though she may still love him, their relationship now will never be more than platonic. Not to imply that she's going around clutching a photo of Lindsey to her breast and weeping herself to sleep - after all, it's not like there was a big chance they would ever get together again anyway. Even so, there is a psychological difference between a slim chance and no chance at all, and that difference might have hurt her heart just a little bit. But despite all that, it all comes back to the fact that "she loves him still."

[[Log and short summaries concluding Roy and Riza's road tripping around Amestris and critical moments, bringing them back to the point in time to go to the Nexus]] ******* If you negotiate the minefield in the drive, And beat the dogs and cheat the cold electronic eyes, And if you make it past the shotgun in the hall, Dial the combination, open the priesthole, And if I'm in, I'll tell you what's behind the wall. [[Summary written by -mun]] For numerous factors, relating to their AWOL status and Roy's injury, Riza is the sole driver through this. She's also purchased a bit of laudanum she takes to help her sleep, which is usually done in the front seat of the car for a few hours each night stopped in a remote location. She's fallen off the diet that Russell had prescribed for her, which had been doing some marginal good -- not enough, but a bit. She's just this side of an emotional breakdown. There's not much said between her and Roy through this. She's taken him around so they can visit with the others -- separately, of course. She lets Roy go first, and then visits with them for a short bit while he waits on her. It's mostly a time of assurances that they're okay and goodbyes. Kain Fuery almost follows Riza back -- but he's got too many family ties of his own to keep him in Amestris. But he sees something in Riza's eyes that has him very worried, and he brings these worries up to Roy before they leave. Kain was their last stop among the men, stationed not quite as far as Dublith, but at an outpost south of Central. They drove north again through Central with a stop off at Hughes's grave, and then further still, with Roy directing Riza toward a more remote area to the Northwest. Meanwhile, over the last day or so as they near his destination, he'd considered what Kain had told him. ******* [[Scenes played between and muns]] <Riza> ::has been more or less silent all this while unless spoken to, very deferring, demure, very servile demeanor, tending to everything that she can and still anticipating what she can for him. She knows none of this is easy for him either and she's -trying- so -hard not to add to that, to make it as easy as she can; silent, looking out the windshield, only half-seeing the road - not that there's really anything to watch for; she's paying enough attention to it to not drive into a ditch:: <Roy> ::Sitting back, watching the road as well... mulling over everything that Fuery told him... glancing at Riza every so often, studying her...:: <Hayate> ::For the record? Once they're done with this trip, he REFUSES TO GO FOR CAR RIDES ANY MORE!:: <Riza> ::she's about 10 pounds underweight, she doesn't each much, her hands shake almost constantly, just tiny little tremors, and half the time, when just looking off, her eyes are wide and just a bit confused/scared/bewildered-looking;right now, she's rather blank-faced, kinda fixed-gaze and as still as one can be while driving:: <Roy> <q> Pull to the side of the road, would you? ::Looking out the window still:: <Riza> ::glances to him, murmurs a soft agreement; it's a country road with precious little in the way of anything up there, stops with one wheel off into the grass and engages the parking brake:: <Roy> <q> Are you feeling all right? ::He's more in the mood to probe her to see what kind of answers he can get before he calls her on anything:: <Riza> ::looks at him quickly, wide-eyed, bewildered, maybe just a little panicked at being asked that out of the blue, like a cornered animal; blinks a few times, then her lips curl into a big smile without her eyes changing:: Wha- <_< Of course. Why? What's wrong? Are you all right? <Roy> ... ::Looking at her now:: ... ::Sighs, looks out the window:: <q> I see. ... You know, Kain told me that he was worried about you. ::Letting that hang for a moment, waiting for her reaction...:: <Riza> ... ::looks out the windshield, hands still on the wheel:: Kain is a very sweet man and he worries about people he cares about. He's always worried about me, it's just his nature. <Roy> ... ::Looking at her again:: <q> He told me that he was concerned that you might be suicidal. I told him that that was foolish, what with the fact that you've got a new life with someone who cares about you, someone who needs you. ::He's actually not going to call too much attention to loss here, that's a touchy subject for him...:: After all, Edward's been through so much. I know you wouldn't want to put him through any more anguish. ... And if I'm wrong, then I guess Kain was right, 'cause Riza Hawkeye would already be dead before she'd do that... <Riza> ........ ::getting paler as he talks, gripping the wheel until her knuckles are white, eyes wide and looking somewhere else that's not there in the distance, breathing shallow and unsteady, like the breaths are reflexive and she's trying to hold her breath and stopping each quick intake as soon as it starts, not saying anything at first:: <Roy> ::Keeping his eye on her:: ... <q> Breathe, Hawkeye. <Riza> ... ::tiny little tentative breaths that gradually get deeper and even out:: <q> Of- of course not. ::shriveling a bit - gaze dropping; maybe people think she would because she's already abandoned one person she supposedly cared about, didn't she?:: <Roy> <q> I don't suppose you'll be -honest- with me if I ask what's on your mind? <Riza> ::flinches a bit at that:: ... <vq> I don't want to hurt you with anything. <Roy> <q> I wouldn't ask if I weren't expecting an answer besides the norm. <Riza> ... ::looks at him, she's visibly shaking now, she's scared to death of saying -anything-...:: <Roy> ... ::Looking at her... sighs:: <q> You -can- talk, you know... <Riza> ... ::looking away, closing her eyes, still gripping the wheel like a lifeline:: ... <vq> I know - I know all that, an- and... that's... the only reason I don't, some days. And wh- what I was thinking... it's probably a bit much to expect people to believe that. That I wouldn't, I mean. <Roy> <q> Why? ::Looking at her, leaning his head back against the window:: <Riza> ... <vq> Because people think... see me as... having already abandoned one person I said I cared about. Wh- what's... it's not like I have any sort of track record for actually... be- being there, staying. ::her voice is shaking, and it's harder and harder for her to breathe again as she talks and she is not letting go of that wheel for anything:: <Roy> <q> -Breathe-, Hawkeye. Do I look like I think that? Do I? ::Looking at her:: I did, once, but that was a couple years ago. I've had time to think, to examine what happened. You quit, but I left. <Riza> ::slightly deeper breaths now, but still shallow:: ... <vq> And I don't blame you for leaving at all. and other people think that way too. I... I realize now... it doesn't matter what I meant. ::voice is thicker now, strained:: J- just... what I did. Or didn't do. ::she's a dog of the military, her only value's in what she can do for others:: <Roy> ... ... ... ::reaches over and puts his hand on her forehead, thumb on her hair:: <q> Now where the hell do you get off thinking like that? I don't think I took everything I tried to instill in you away when I left... ::Tone about as soft as he can manage... lightly brushing her bangs with his thumb:: <Riza> ... ... ... ::she's shaking like a leaf now:: <vq> n-not everything and... you di- didn't take it. ... it just... went. there wasn't any gravity left. I... I did try to move on though. move forward. I... ::voice cracking, tears are just going down her cheeks now:: >_< I am so sorry for everything. I -never-, ever, ever meant to hurt you. <Roy> ... <q> I didn't mean to hurt you either. Lots of mistakes on both our parts once our plans reached their end, huh? <Riza> ... ... ... ::slow nod, shaky sighing breath:: ... <vqw> Can ... can I explain something, please? <Roy> ... ::Nods slightly:: <q> Go ahead. ::Keeping his hand gently on her forehead, kinda steeling himself against anything here...: <Riza> ::eyes still closed, still shaking:: <q> I -did- try to find the way home, for months. By the time he showed up, I didn't know if I'd ever see Amestris again. ::or you:: It might be easier to understand what I'm talking about after you see it. A familiar had to force a portal, and I only met Belladonna myself recently. And after Dante had me kidnapped... after what happened... Kain would have been on the money with his fears. If anyone had left me alone for a while... he refused to. I think he knew. It was after that. ::she didn't just wake up one day and hop into a new romance or anything:: <Roy> ... ::Nods slightly:: <q> I don't doubt it, Riza. It's not something that you just leap into... <Riza> <vq> I'm sorry. I know it's not something you wanted to hear anything about, but... I couldn't... leave it just perhaps looking like I'd up and moved on and everything was fine and dandy. I spent a week in a cell after Envy pulled a perfect imitation of you to get me out of the AVF to deliver me to Dante... and I didn't think anyone would look for me. <Roy> ... <q> You're in a good relationship. ::That's really all that he's willing to say about this...:: <q> I couldn't really ask for a better situation for you. <Riza> ... ... ::looks at him... giving him a teary, lopsided attempt at a smile:: <vq> I'm not looking for approval or forgiveness, don't worry... I just... ... know what it feels like to think... it must have been very easy to... move on. Forget everything. And feel like... none of it was worth as much as you'd hoped. ::voice cracking, looking at him:: I don't expect or ask for any forgiveness. I ... I... the last thing i want is to mention any of this to you, to run a risk of it being like I'm rubbing your face in it when I'm not meaning that. I just want... you to know that I did not wake up one day and be over everything. Because I lived with those questions too and they hurt. <Roy> .... ::Just can't say anything, just keeping his hand on her forehead, brushing his thumb over her bangs lightly:: <Riza> ::doesn't mind that, knows there's really no easy way to say or take any of that... but was in that position of honestly believing she hadn't been worth that much to him if he could walk away from her so easily, and knows how much more it hurts being able to believe something like that:: ... ::opening her eyes again, looking at him:: ... ::closes her eyes and rubs them, ducking her head, and drawing in a shaky breath:: ... <vq> I'm good enough to keep driving if you want. <Roy> ... <q> You're sure? <Hayate> ::Probably only noticable now, but he's whining for attention in the back:: <Riza> <q> Yes, I- ... >_> ... ::ah, hell with it, turns off the car:: or maybe as long as we're stopped in the middle of nowhere, I'll let him out for a bit <Roy> ::Looks back... faint, dry chuckle:: <q> That's probably a good idea. <Riza> ::opens her door and gets out, letting Hayate out:: <Hayate> ::bounding -out- of the car... sniffing around quickly... okay... stay near the car and mom, or go to the little puppy's ditch?:: <Roy> ::Contemplating staying in the car... gets out, stretching his legs:: <Riza> ::leaning against the driver's side, looking up at the sky, humming quietly to herself:: <Hayate> ::Okay, grass for the puppy!:: <Roy> <q> So, is there much wilderness in this Nexus? <Riza> <q> Not really like this... it's a very... civilized sort of nature that I'm not sure is entirely real. ::turns around to look at him, leaning on the car:: Matter of fact, you go to the far edges of the developed areas.. and there's nothing there. I mean that literally. It's just... blank. Nothingness. Just whiteness. Save for portals here and there. It's a place between worlds. <Roy> .... ::Nods:: I see. >_> That's going to take some getting used to. <Riza> It does, but at the same time, it's also convienent. I spent 2 weeks of vacation time in a ... well... it was several decades after, and probably wasn't the same world per se, Earth is the world where Edward wound up. Anyhow, on Earth, in a place called Texas, just... a little motel by a river for a couple weeks by myself. A very interesting place. ...:;quirks a lopsided, wry smile:: They have a car model there called 'Mustang'. The one I saw was the same color blue as our uniforms had been. <Roy> ::Nods slightly, leaning on the car... mun apologises for him. ;_; Small talk seems to die a quick, brutal death around him...:: <Riza> ::looks away, turning away again, silent now:: **** <Riza> ::nearing his parents' place, not that she knows it, is completely lost up here ._. has no idea where she is among all these back country roads, has never been in this part of the country before and isn't sure where they're going, just getting told to here and there whenever the turns come up:: <Roy> ... <q> Stop here. ::They're still at least a mile from any place in particular:: <Riza> ::blinks, stops the car, eyeing him:: <Roy> ... <q> We've come far enough. ... I'll walk the rest of the way. ... ::Notice how quickly he's moving... or just what kind of death grip the seat has on his ass XD:: <Riza> ... ::looking at him... has no idea why for any of this; she had no idea his parents were still living, let alone where they lived, and there's no house in sight out here <_< can only surmise that maybe he's ashamed of them or his background and doesn't want her seeing where he grew up; whatever it is, she's not pressing /that/ issue:: ... ::but...:: ... <q> Are you sure? <Roy> <q> I'm sure. ... I don't want to be seen. <Riza> .. ::blink... watching him:: ... I... I thought you wanted to see them again...? <Roy> ... ::Looking out the windshield... drawing a breath:: <q> Just see them... not be seen. <Riza> ... ::frowns... looking down, thinking:: ... <q> I have no idea about any of this... so I'm probably speaking out of line here, way out of line... but wanting to drive up here, to walk I don't know how far just to see them... well... Whatever happened... you're not planning on coming back... and what-ifs and should-haves and things like that tend to wear away at someone. ... Not... ... It's your choice, if you want to see them or not, I mean, -really- see them. Talk to them... But... whichever way... however it goes... that's your choice and I'll back you on that an- and... I'm... I'm still here. ... and I'm still your friend, if you'll have me. <Roy> ... ::Looks at Riza:: ... ::Looks out the windshield again:: ... <q> Wait here with the car. ::Nodding slightly... drawing a breath:: <vq> Thank you. ::Getting out before she can respond, closing the door, walking down the road... okay, ducking off the road after a short ways:: <Riza> ... ... ::looking back into the back seat, turning off the car and turning around, reaching back to pet Hayate, shaky:: ******* [[Summary written by -mun]] Roy's just trying to do some basic surveilance of the house when his father rides up on where he is. They probably wouldn't say much to each other, but Roy's dad would tell him to come back to the house, and that he and Roy's mom have both missed him. He'd then ride back towards the ranch house, leaving it up to Roy whether or not to come. I think Roy'd wait there for a few minutes, kinda... "Oh fuck, what now?" He would go to the house, if only because he doesn't want to be remembered as having run away. His mom would have some coffee, and maybe some cheese and crackers ready, she'd have been a little teary when Roy comes in, she'd grab him in a tight hug. I don't actually see much being -said- for a while... Roy's mom would be doing most of the talking, asking him how he's been, what he's been doing, what she can do... Roy's dad's more the strong, silent type. I get the feeling he'd be a little short tempered by Roy's quiet, short answers and otherwise unapproachability... But he wouldn't snap, and Roy's mom would be doing her damnedest to make Roy feel at home again. Roy's dad would be the one to tell him that he can stay for dinner, Roy's mom would work to make what she remembers as his favorite... Roy would accept, and he'd say that he's got a driver that should probably eat too, as well as a dog. He'd be pretty quiet, and it -would- frustrate his dad... I get the feeling he'd hug them both before he leaves, though, tell them he loves them, and that he'll be fine. ******* [[Summary written by -mun]] Riza is still Riza, on her very best behavior in front of his parents, doing all she can to make it as easy for him as possible, and not attract questions or censure or offend them in any manner. The two and a half day drive back to the East HQ is in almost complete silence. Both of them are ready for this to be over, emotionally and physically drained. Roy spends most of his time laying down in the back seat. Riza pushes herself to her final limits, stopping only when utterly necessary for rest. They still get back a day or so over the one week mark, with Ed having arrived the day before.

She wasn't feeling hungry (as usual) she'd had a glass of water before her shower and wasn't particularly thirsty either. The idea of reading, or anything else, they just left her with a now-familiar feeling of 'why bother'.

The herbal antidepressant remedy Russell had come up with worked a little bit; she wasn't feeling quite so... insanely on the edge and in a constant crackling state of buried frenzied panic, trapped in her own mind. Instead, it was just a dull, lazy lethargy, a listlessness that left her content with doing nothing at all.

And nothing at all was what she chose to do -- as usual. A comfortable chair by the window, and a blank, numb state of mind, looking at nothing in particular and scarcely moving.

He didn't look it, he knew. Too young, too clean. No one turned away from him on the street, averting the eyes, but he waited for them to. Everyone looked away from vagabonds, adrift and homeless. No one wanted to see the nightmares that could be them. It was the new dress that caught his eye, brilliant blue beside the dumpster, unstained and untattered, the lace still white. But the doll wearing it was like him - clad in an outward appearance of fresh and clean, but underneath it was decay from a life lived too hard. On a whim, a flight of fancy, he picked it up - there. He wasn't alone anymore. Two broken down remnants of an era slipping into forgetfulness to the rest of the world, wearing their disguises of something wholesome and unbent. Later, pieces started to fall away, the china face and arms laced with spidery cracks, and the paint was faded, flaked off, leaving a ghost trace over the blankness. He tried to keep the pieces together, but he hadn't realized how deep the fissures in the china ran. His broken, quiet companion fell to pieces in his hands, and there was nothing he could do to stop the inevitable. Glue didn't seem to work, not at first. He'd put the broken pieces back together, but they'd fall apart again before it would have a chance to set. Again and again, until they were both a mess, he tried. In his attempts, he saw what the doll had once been, how lovely once upon a time. All he had to do was put the pieces together again, to mend the cracks, to repaint the face and bring life back into those dull glass eyes. If he had to hold the doll together long enough to give the glue a chance to set, then hold it he would. Sleep could come later. Food was something that could wait. It would be so easy to abandon the doll, at least for anyone else, but if he did, he knew the doll was lost. How could he fix anything, if he couldn't fix a broken doll? With care, he applied the glue one more time, and once more as needed.

Written by Riza while on vacation. Roy, You were the center of my universe, and I think perhaps you still are. Maybe you always will be. I don't know if I'll ever give you this letter -- if I'll choose to, if I'll have the chance, or what. But I need to talk to you. I've needed to talk to you. And looking back over all the years, perhaps I should have said more. But it's too little, too late, isn't it? I miss you. I've missed you for what's feeling like forever and a day now. And I love you. I think part of me always will. I'd built my life with you as the heart, the center, the soul. When you left, you took those with you. But I have got to let go of them, of you, and go on. I want to come back, I won't lie on that. I do. Maybe I will, if my worst fears are realized here, and I find I have no true home to return once I go back. But I know I can't, that I shouldn't. Because if I go back, there's nothing I wouldn't do to earn your forgiveness, to be taken back. Sitting here now, it's a frightening thought to realize that I would put a gun in my mouth and pull the trigger if you told me that's what it would take to make things better. That's how much I need you. Even I can see that's not healthy. You're an addiction, a drug, and I need you. I'm not even sure if this is what love is anymore. I'm not sure if what I feel is addiction or love, or just a bone-deep terror at letting go of everything I ever wished for and taking a new road. I never meant to abandon you, but intentions count for little in the end. I never did tell you anything; I was too afraid to, afraid to let anyone know or see that I wasn't really as strong as I seemed. And I know you would have tried to fix things and I couldn't bring myself to put anything else on you -- there was already so much, so many burdens I could see pulling you down, especially after he died, and I tried to fill that empty space left the best I could as well and I couldn't justify putting any more problems on you. I was supposed to support you -- support is supposed to be strong, isn't it? And I couldn't let anyone else see either, because you needed me to be strong, so I thought. I suppose it must have come as a terrible shock to realize I wasn't strong, when I finally cracked under the weight of the realization that the person you needed to be protected from all along had been me. And you left. You left me for abandoning you. And I didn't follow, because I couldn't see where you didn't have full right to blame and hate me for what happened. I still can't, truth be told. I think you're well in your right to hate me now. And I miss you. The bitterest pill to swallow is the knowledge that all of this? Is my fault. The mess my life became? My choices led me there. And I failed you. Worst of all, I'm not really sure what I could have done differently. Would you have understood if I showed you how weak I was under all those masks? Or would it have brought you down? I have to let you go, and find a way to live without a heart and soul -- or find new ones. Because I can't tell if this is love anymore, or fear. And there's someone who I hope will still need me, who I'm trying to trust enough to take the weight of things while trying not to be scared to death if there's too much, it'll take us both down. I thought I'd feel better getting this out on paper. To tell you these things, to say goodbye. Instead, I just feel sick. And I want to run back now but I can't, I won't. I'd lose what little respect for myself I might still retain. I have to prove to myself I can breathe on my own, if only for a little while, and I don't think I can. I'm sorry. You depended on me. You chose the wrong person. I just wish I could have been who you believed me to be. Always and never, - Riza
